Articles.Content:
I am here for your hill (crater)

Time to use this bulldozer to make it a hill again and reinstate the moderator flag upon it.

I burn the flag and replace with mine! btw i also destroyed that bulldozer with a RPG.

My hill!

I don't think you mind I ballistic missile'd the crap out of your hill, place my flag atop it after making sure my gas masks kept my safe from the radiation that came from the newly developed nuclear charges.

My radioactive crater!

After the length of the reconstruction of Hiroshima, I covered the hill with a new layer of earth and claimed it.

My post-radioactive hill.

I use a virus bomb (Warhammer 40k)

My burned hill (and planete)
I use a portal that destroys all life forms but keeps nonliving objects okay. It goes to Sedna and it is now my heavily armored indestructible hill.
Indestructible? Several billion degrees outa do it. Your "indestructible" armor (along with the hill) melted. My pool of lava.
<insert rust="" monster=""> now my Red hill!</insert>
I drop an antimatter bomb onto your whimsical red hill. I then fill the crater with water, and build a huge steel spire in the center. The crater-lake, I fill with electric eels and sharks. My spire.

Antimatter? Screw that. I just trigger the star to supernova, and if that didn't kill you, the black hole resulting will. Then I dock a whole bunch of ships together and make a hill shaped spacecraft.

My Hillship.

...didn't I just put the hill back to normal last time I posted?

Where's my Delorian at? I need to visit the hill in all possible futures and ensure that it remains a proper dirt and grass hill.

> 
> ...didn't I just put the hill back to normal last time I posted?
> Where's my Delorian at? I need to visit the hill in all possible futures and ensure that it remains a proper dirt and grass hill.

I shall enlists the help of the Vogans and the Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy Mk2, that Delorian would take way too much of your time!

My hill in all the infinite veurse!

The hill then went into "cataclysmic fragmentation" and was destroyed.

I claimed another hill that looked "normal", as OdinYggd described. No flags are planted, though, as the climate is somewhat inhospitable.
I take a look at that hill, spit on it, and make a fresh, normal, hill. Mine!

I bring a couple of Harkonnen Devastators and overload them right on top of your hill. Big explosion, good-bye hill.

My plot of land. (Maybe I'll start farming...)

I drop a big bomb on your plot of land, build a regular hill on top of it, make a moat around the hill filled with deadly things, and build a spire on top of the hill. I also have walls behind the moat. My well-defended hill.

I increase the gravitational force of the planet, flattening your hill. I build a hill of Dalekinium.

My bumpy bronze-colored hill.

I drop a black hole nuke on your hill. I then rebuild said hill only to make it hollow an out of animantium I then Live in said Shiny hill. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Must we always destroy the hill?

It should be natural earth and grassy, pockmarked with small craters from mortar fire and rockets crashing into it over the years of bloody battles for its fate. 

However as of this moment I am seizing this hill, restoring its proper appearance to that of a terrestrial grassy hill, and building a dread gazebo on top.

A restart this could be nice.

back on topic: I send the NUMBERS of mortars to blow up your little gazebo, and once you have left I fortify it with \*\*\*\* grade concert and re-bar! Edit: wait the forums don't like Nazis?

"let them come"

Heh, ninja'd.

I melt your flimsy concrete with concentrated acid, and destroy the remains with an awful lot of dynamite. My hill.

I come back with a Kawasawa and a gen5 AC and stomp on you with it.

(for thous that dont know what an AC is.

![opening-mech.png](http://www.armoredcoregame.com/images/opening-mech.png)

My rubbled hill with awesome mech
Oh, is that all? A nice big vat of acid will set you right... though I do hate acidic soil. The soil of the hill now appears to be too acidic for plant life... ah well.

....didn't I JUST fix this.

Oh well. Bulk Lime is cheap and will clean it right up, along with mixed wildflower seed to make a much more environmentally-friendly hill than just grass. 

Next person to blow the hill up is gonna get it.

USES ROYAL CANTERLOT VOICE TO SHOUT EVERYONE OFF...

My hill
